thread.title: 5 Nights, 5 Dinners: My Simple Weekly Meal Plan — Meal Planning for Beginners
thread.title_full: 5 Nights, 5 Dinners: My Simple Weekly Meal Plan — Meal Planning for Beginners

author: Meghan Splawn
title: 5 Nights, 5 Dinners: My Simple Weekly Meal Plan — Meal Planning for Beginners
text:
(Image credit: Chungah Rhee ) 3. Wednesday is BFD (breakfast for dinner). 
Hey, it's cheap and my kids are guaranteed to eat it whether we have pancakes or waffles or scrambled eggs. It's also something fun to bring to the middle of the week. 25 Weeknight-Friendly Ways to Eat Breakfast for Dinner 4. Thursdays are for leftovers. 
As unglamorous as it sounds, a night for leftovers is key for minimizing food waste and saving our sanity. I might turn Sunday's roast chicken into soup or make roasted vegetables into grilled cheese. Or we eat leftovers smorgasbord-style with sliced bread, cheeses, and a few pickles. 
How to use what you've got: The Kitchn's Ultimate Guide for Using Up Every Type of Food 5. Friday is for pizza-lovers. 
Friday pizza night doubles as a way to clean out the fridge — bits of this and that make excellent topping fodder — but it can also be a break from cooking before the weekend. Delicious and practical! 
Do you have themed nights for meal planning in your house? More posts in Meal Planning for Beginners
